bugs.title: We package an unmaintained fork of shellinabox

bugzilla.short_desc: We package an unmaintained fork of shellinabox

long_desc.thetext:
We package a fork of shellinabox from https://github.com/pythonanywhere/shellinabox_fork which hasn't been updated in nearly three years.

Meanwhile, https://github.com/shellinabox/shellinabox had a release three days ago.

I have not compared the features of each, but as this is security sensitive software I would think we'd want to package something which is actually maintained.

Alternatively I could just make a separate package of the other fork, but the naming would be kind of confusing.  I'll probably just do that anyway but I figured it's better if we could coordinate.

I opened the following ticket upstream to ask about compatibility and possibly pass the one patch Fedora carries up to them:
  https://github.com/shellinabox/shellinabox/issues/334

I have a cleaned-up spec with which I'm experimenting but you may not want it as I don't maintain my specs for any ancient EPEL releases.

Actually I swapped to the other fork because the original one was not maintained.

I can swap back, will look at it (I'm currently travelling) and hour spec file.

Thanks for notifying.

Well, what we have here is yet another fork; the original upstream appears to be completely dead.  But they've worked to pull in everything from the fork that's currently packaged in Fedora, as well as other patches they've found.  They're also willing to take the one patch Fedora is carrying.

In progress:

https://github.com/shellinabox/shellinabox/issues/334

bugs.title: CVE-2015-8400 shellinabox: DNS rebinding attack due to HTTP fallback [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-8400 shellinabox: DNS rebinding attack due to HTTP fallback [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-8400 shellinabox: DNS rebinding attack due to HTTP fallback

long_desc.thetext:
The shellinabox server, while using the HTTPS protocol, allows HTTP fallback through the "/plain" URL.

Upstream issue:

https://github.com/shellinabox/shellinabox/issues/355

Original report:

http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/12/02/6

Created shellinabox tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1287578]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1287579]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1287577,1287578

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for 

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi update submission link(s) instead:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new?type_=security&bugs=1287577,1287578

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by slaanesh.
This update has obsoleted [shellinabox-2.18-1.el5](https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2015-7886), and has inherited its bugs and notes.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has reached 14 days in testing and can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
This update has been submitted for stable by slaanesh.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
* Added support for middle-click paste
* Improved iOS support
* New logic to enable soft keyboard icon
* Disable HTTPS fallback using the URL /plain. Consequently disables automatic upgrades from HTTP to HTTPS (CVE-2015-8400)

----

- Fixed handling of large HTTP packets
- Fixed services cleanup on session timeout
- Added logging to system log files for important/fatal errors
- Support for perfect forward secrecy (SSL)
- Disabled secure client initiated renegotiations (SSL)
- Minor CSS fixes
- SSL security issues
- Firefox international keyboard issue
- 256 color support
- Message passing support for embedded shellinabox
- Unix domain socket support
- Real IP recognition over proxy
- Other minor bug fixes and improvements
- Packaging: add license macro, switch to GitHub sources
title: shellinabox-2.19-1.el5
